Threads.Subject: EK-RA6M4 + ZMOD4410 PMOD
Threads.Body:
Hi Folks,

I'm a pretty new user so I have been working through tutorials and examples. However, I have run into a problem running the ZMOD4410_RA6M4_NonOS demo code. I can't seem to get any data through to the expressions window in e2 studio after rechecking my steps, multiple times, following the documentation.

I have already run up the similar HS400x_RA6M4_NonOS without any difficulty, so I know that I2C is working OK. My gut is telling me that there may be an I2C address mismatch in the code for the sensor (which would be unfortunate for a demo) but I was wondering if anyone familiar with this example had any suggestions of where this may be going wrong?

Thanks!

Threads.Subject: R_IIC_MASTER_Write, Request for p_src to treat pointed to data as constant
Threads.Body:
While not necessary, it would be nice to not have to copy non-volatile parameters to volatile memory prior to writing it to EEPROM via I2C.

The reason that R_IIC_MASTER_Write does not treat the data as constant is probably that IIC read and write routines make use of the same helper function.  I often have need to load medium sized default lists of parameters and profiles.  This is the first API that I've come across that didn't treat data for IIC writes as non-volatile.

Thank you.

Threads.Subject: I2C send memory address in read operation
Threads.Body:
Hello,

I'm trying to implement a comunication with a I2C device. I have a RA6M4 microcontroller and just one slave device on I2C.

The write operation seems to be good, as far the device has a expected behaviour.

But, in read operation, i can not fulfill the sequence of the device. The sequence is like a I2C read memory:

The point is:

- If I execute the read function (R_IIC_MASTER_Read), the start, device address, read bit, and acknoledge is good, but register address is always 0xFF, like a dummy byte.

- If I execute the write function, (R_IIC_MASTER_Write), the start and device address is good, but it sends always the write bit (0).

So, how can I achieve the correct sequence? No examples found that work it.

Thanks.

Threads.Subject: RA4M2 flash memory configuration
Threads.Body:
I am employing the RA4M2 microcontroller and configuring the flash memory. I possess an application code that needs to be integrated into the firmware. However, when attempting to download the application code into the flash, the firmware crashes. This occurs because the application interface software attempts to upload the application code to the same location as the firmware. To provide a clearer picture, let's consider the designated blocks for the flash.

#define FLASH_HP_CF_BLCOK_0 0x00000000U /* 8 KB: 0x00000000 - 0x00001FFF */

#define FLASH_HP_CF_BLOCK_1 0x00002000U /* 8 KB: 0x00002000 - 0x00003FFF */

#define FLASH_HP_CF_BLOCK_2 0x00004000U /* 8 KB: 0x00004000 - 0x00005FFF */

#define FLASH_HP_CF_BLOCK_3 0x00006000U /* 8 KB: 0x00006000 - 0x00007FFF */

#define FLASH_HP_CF_BLOCK_4 0x00008000U /* 8 KB: 0x00008000 - 0x00009FFF */

#define FLASH_HP_CF_BLOCK_5 0x0000A000U /* 8 KB: 0x0000A000 - 0x0000BFFF */

#define FLASH_HP_CF_BLOCK_6 0x0000C000U /* 8 KB: 0x0000C000 - 0x0000DFFF */

#define FLASH_HP_CF_BLOCK_7 0x0000E000U /* 8 KB: 0x0000E000 - 0x0000FFFF */

#define FLASH_HP_CF_BLOCK_8 0x00010000U /* 32 KB: 0x00010000 - 0x00017FFF */

#define FLASH_HP_CF_BLOCK_9 0x00018000U /* 32 KB: 0x00018000 - 0x0001FFFF */

#define FLASH_HP_CF_BLCOK_10 0x00020000U /* 32 KB: 0x00020000 - 0x0004FFFF */

The application software attempts to upload code into FLASH_HP_CF_BLOCK_8, and my firmware also occupies this area, resulting in a crash.

As the firmware is continually evolving, I aim to allocate a distinct region in the flash exclusively for my application code, preventing the firmware from encroaching into this space. How can I achieve this?

Threads.Subject: SelfTest ROM CRC problem
Threads.Body:
Hi there!

I'm using EK-RA2A1 evaluation board and trying to implement IEC 60730/60335 Self Test Library for RA MCU (CM4_CM23) to the project. When following the attached PDF about how to implement the CRC calculation of the ROM, when building the project doesn't create addcrc.srec so I can't add to the debug and the crc calculation gives error.

Added the "arm-none-eabi-objcopy -O srec "${ProjName}.elf" "Original.srec" & ${ProjDirPath}/srec/srec_cat @${ProjDirPath}/srec/CRCcalcCmd256KB.txt" to Project/Properties/C C++ Build/Settings -> Build Steps -> Post-build steps -> Command(s) but it does nothing apparently.

What am I missing? Thanks in advance!

Best regars,

Aitor Azkolain

Threads.Subject: RA6M3 SDRAM + QSPI max performance
Threads.Body:
Hi,

We're testing the capabilities of RA6M3 to be able to display some basic videos.

We're using M13-RA6M3-EK-SDRAM kit from M13 that includes both external SDRAM and QSPI Flash and we have succeded putting GUIX project into flash and using SDRAM, but we're getting some non expected results.

The goal is to use a 7" TFT, 800x480 but right now we're performing the tests in the default 4,3" 480x272 included. Searching the limits in the default TFT might give us an idea of the results in a display with more resolution.

We want to achieve that max possible FPS, at this moment  in order to do this we are increasing Timer Ticks per second from default 100 up to 400 from the System Thread

At this moment we have configured the project to use 565 codification because allows us to compile the project with or without using SDRAM

Buy doing this if r_glcdc Framebuffer is set to .bss section the kit is capable of displaying the 100 jpeg images in about 3 seconds,

Just changing the Framebuffer to .sdram section and with no other change the kit displays the same set of images in about 5 seconds.

We're wondering if there is a better way to increase the fps other than changing the System Thread ? Or maybe if we have to make more changes in order to achieve higher fps with sdram

I attach demo project.

Thanks !!!!

PJ

Content.HtmlName: RA6M3 SDRAM + QSPI max performance
Content.HtmlDescription:
Hi,

We're testing the capabilities of RA6M3 to be able to display some basic videos.

We're using M13-RA6M3-EK-SDRAM kit from M13 that includes both external SDRAM and QSPI Flash and we have succeded putting GUIX project into flash and using SDRAM, but we're getting some non expected results.

The goal is to use a 7" TFT, 800x480 but right now we're performing the tests in the default 4,3" 480x272 included. Searching the limits in the default TFT might give us an idea of the results in a display with more resolution.

We want to achieve that max possible FPS, at this moment  in order to do this we are increasing Timer Ticks per second from default 100 up to 400 from the System Thread

At this moment we have configured the project to use 565 codification because allows us to compile the project with or without using SDRAM

Buy doing this if r_glcdc Framebuffer is set to .bss section the kit is capable of displaying the 100 jpeg images in about 3 seconds,

Just changing the Framebuffer to .sdram section and with no other change the kit displays the same set of images in about 5 seconds.

We're wondering if there is a better way to increase the fps other than changing the System Thread ? Or maybe if we have to make more changes in order to achieve higher fps with sdram

I attach demo project.

Thanks !!!!

PJ

Threads.Subject: RA4M2- Changing the duty cycle of running GPT Timer
Threads.Body:
Hi Team,

We would required to change the running GPT timer duty cycle to a new value without resetting the GPT timer.

We observed that, any change in duty cycle of the running GPR timer requires a reset or a fresh start and thus it creates a flicker or temporary reset period. We need to avoid these reset period.

Could you please, share an example or reference to change the duty cycle of running GPT timer without reset?

Thanks and Regards,

Akshay

Threads.Subject: RA6M1 clock issue
Threads.Body:
I have my clock configured in the FSP configuration as XTAL 12MHz, PLL Src: XTAL, PLL Div /1, PLL Mul x20.0, PLL 240MHz, Clock Src: PLL, PCLKA Div/2, PCLKA 120MHz.

But I have a uart running off PCLKA and I set the baud to 19200.  When I looked at the databits coming out on an oscilloscope the baud rate was 960 baud.  This is as if the clock to the uart is 6MHz and PLL Clock output is 12MHz.  When I set the baudrate to 384000, then the data comes out at 19200.  

Does this mean the PLL is not working or is there some other setting I need to fix and if so how can I fix it?  Thanks.

Threads.Subject: VSCode watch expression "The current thread has terminated"
Threads.Body:
Hi!

I am using the Renesas VSCode environment when developing a FreeRTOS application for EK-RA6M4.

However I am having trouble with watch expressions. Watch expressions work fine, until I enter a FreeRTOS task.

Now after entering a FreeRTOS task and trying to check a variable when a breakpoint has been hit it says that the "The current thread has terminated." However stepping, breakpoints, registers and call stack work just fine. Also I have tried using the debug console to give commands to gdb, but every command fails with the same message.

I have tried configuring the launch.json if there is supposed to be some parameter I am missing, but for now no luck. I've pasted my launch.json below.

{
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "configurations": [
    {
      "type": "renesas-hardware",
      "request": "launch",
      "name": "Renesas GDB Hardware Debugging",
      "target": {
        "deviceFamily": "RA",
        "device": "R7FA6M4AF",
        "debuggerType": "SEGGERJLINKARM",
        "rtos": "FreeRTOS",
        "serverParameters": ["-uInterface=", "JTAG", "-w", "0", "-uConnectMode=", "RESET", "-uWorkRamAddress=", "0x0", "-uSyncMode=", "async"],
        "showDevDebugOutput": "vscode"
      }
    }
  ]
}

I am using a J-Link Plus debugger, also tried with the onboard J-Link but I face the same issue.

Thank you.

Threads.Subject: Model inference speed on RA8M1 is not expected!
Threads.Body:
Hello there

I can't find the AI benchmark of the RA8M platform on the website, so I trying to run the TinyML Perf models on RA8M1 evk.

The result is out of my expectations.

I used e-AI Translator 3.10 to convert the models and select the speed priority, cmsis nn int8.

Then port the models files into a hello world project.

Here is the result:

AD01 =  3ms, KWS=38.4ms, RESNet=92.8ms, VVW=127ms

In my opinion, 480Mhz M85 with Helium should be much faster than what I tested.

I attached my project

community.renesas.com/.../ra8m1_5F00_evk_5F00_ml_5F00_benchmark.zip

Threads.Subject: RA8T1 vs RA8M1
Threads.Body:
Hi,

 I was looking forward to the launch of the RA8T1, supposedly for motor control and energy conversion applications, but apparently the RA8T1 is a copy of the RA8M1. It doesn't have high-resolution PWM, CORDIC, better analog integration, etc. I was hoping for a set of peripherals at least on par with what's built into the RA6T2. Are there already plans for new RA8Tx with better analogue integration?

Threads.Subject: CAN mask on mixed ID lengths
Threads.Body:
When using CAN with mixed standard and extended IDs, how do I set the mask register?
I wish to receive Standard ID messages from 0 to 15.

So I set the mask to 0x1FC3FFFF, which should mask all bits apart from bits 0-3 of the SID

However,  the mailbox is also accepting Extended ID messages with the correct bits in the SID field, but with ANY bits in the EID field as if it were not masked at all.

Please advise.

Threads.Body:
Hello,

I'm trying to make the USBHS innterface on RA8M1 work in device mode.  My goal is to make VCC selectable by customer between 1.8-3.3V, whereas the USBHS is always on. The datasheet recommends VCC level in 3.0 - 3.6V and VCC_USB/VCC_USBHS connected to VCC when using USB interface. So the qustion is, if I power VCC with 1.8V whereas powering VCC_USBHS fixed to 3.3V, is this allowed by the configuration and USB interface could be still working?

The development kit doesn't allow me to separate VCC and VCC/USB_HS, so I cannot test this structure on my side.

Thanks,

Guohui

Threads.Subject: Changing MCU/Board with RASC on IAR usage of Class B files
Threads.Body:
Hello, after successfully following the steps outlined here(thank you for these helpful steps!): https://community.renesas.com/mcu-mpu/ra/f/forum/33059/how-to-open-e2studio-files-in-iar-embedded-workbench I can successfully build and debug the code on the EK-RA2L1 kit. However, when I try to change the default configuration of the MCU(like change the board to EK RA2l1 for example) and then generate content in RASC followed by building, I am greeted with errors such as: 

Error[Pe020]: identifier "IRQn_Type" is undefined D:\Work\CLASS B\24Jan\r01an5540ej0100-ra-cm4_cm23-iec60730\Project\RA2L1\ra\fsp\src\bsp\mcu\all\bsp_irq.h 104

and 

Error[Pe020]: identifier "SysTick_IRQn" is undefined D:\Work\CLASS B\24Jan\r01an5540ej0100-ra-cm4_cm23-iec60730\Project\RA2L1\ra\arm\CMSIS_5\CMSIS\Core\Include\core_cm23.h 1945 

and so on. 

You can easily emulate and reproduce these errors by following the above link's guide to the class b safety files for IAR(files located at: https://www.renesas.com/us/en/application/consumer-electronics/appliances/iecul-60730-functional-safety/functional-safety-solutions-class-b#related_application_notes_sample_code here:

)

After adding project files and building/debugging for first time, you can simply generate project content(no matter even if you simply generate project content without any changes to MCU/Board etc selection you will still get the errors always) and be greeted with these errors.

How do I solve this issue? My initial goal is that I want to run these practice tests on the EK RA2l1(RA2L1 2DFP mcu 100 pins) kit, but selecting the board to the relevant kit(automatically allots pins etc to our liking) causes problems as above. After that my end goal is to run this on a different MCU like the RA2L1 3CFM(64 pins) version on my own custom board.

Threads.Subject: RTC capture
Threads.Body:
Hi, I'm trying to use the RTC CAPTURE functionality on an RA6M5 with FSP 4.4.0.

First I configured the GPIO pin as input and confirmed that I can read the state when I press the connected button on my hardware. Next, I configure it to be controlled by the peripheral but when I press the button again the respective bit (R_RTC->RTCCR[2].RTCCR_b.TCST) is not updated at all and remains zero. It is pulled up and must only go to 0 when the button is pressed.

I see there are new API functions in FSP 5.1.0, e.g. timeCaptureGet, but all I need to do is read bit TCST, but that does not seem to capture the event.

1. Will upgrading to FSP 5.1.0 fix this issue?
2. Do you have example code? I searched on the forum but this seems to be very new functionality.

Thank you in advance.
Johann

Threads.Subject: Request for Assistance with Changing CAN Baud Rate on RA6M5 Microcontroller
Threads.Body:
Dear Renesas,

I am writing to seek your expertise and guidance on changing the CAN baud rate in a Renesas RA6M5 microcontroller for a project I am currently working on.

As we progress with our project, we have encountered the need to adjust the CAN baud rate to optimize our communication requirements. Given your experience in embedded systems and microcontroller programming, I thought you might be able to provide valuable insights and recommendations on this matter.

Specifically, I have the following questions and requests:

  1. Could you please provide guidance on the steps involved in changing the CAN baud rate on the RA6M5 microcontroller? Any code snippets or register settings you can share would be greatly appreciated.

  2. Are there any best practices or considerations we should keep in mind when adjusting the baud rate to ensure stable and reliable communication?

  3. If you have any experience or recommendations related to CAN bus configuration on the RA6M5 or similar microcontrollers, I would greatly benefit from your insights.

Thank you in advance for considering my request.

Best regards,

Rao

Threads.Subject: RA6M5 CANFD transmit error every 86th frame
Threads.Body:
I'm using both CAN channels on an RA6M5 MCU, with a mix of the Renesas FSP and direct register access since I'm using the Common FIFO for transmitting. All CAN frames are classical CAN, no CANFD frames. Only on CAN channel 0, every 86th frame fails to transmit; my device reports that it did not receive the acknowledge bit, or a recessive bit error. Other devices on the network report a bit stuffing error. At that point if I abort the transfer, it will continue transmitting another 85 frames normally, then error again. If I don't abort the transfer, it retries forever on the bad frame, generating errors. The contents of this frame are random but valid; there's not one specific ID or payload that causes the issue. If I use internal loopback mode I do not see the error; if I use external loopback mode with other devices in listen-only mode, then I don't get a transmit error but the other devices do report a bit stuffing error. Communication between the other devices works fine, and my RA6M5 has no issues receiving the frames transmitted by other devices. The CAN bitrate, source clock, and delay between frames has no impact.

Has anyone seen anything like this? Suggestions or ideas on how to fix or at least investigate further?

Threads.Subject: RA4M2 TrustZone SCE9 AES-256
Threads.Body:
Hi.

I have EK-RA4M2 and I test the TrustZone feature.

I created two project:

- secure project: SCE Protected Mode, ARM TrustZone Context RA Port and another stacks;

- non secure project: GPIO and SCI(UART) stacks.

I did not inject any keys to the MCU.

I tested:

- R_SCE_RandomNumberGenerate() - works;

- R_SCE_SHA256_Init()/R_SCE_SHA256_Update()/R_SCE_SHA256_FInal() - work, the calculation result is correct.

But, when I added the functions to my code: R_SCE_AES256GCM_DecryptInit()/R_SCE_AES256GCM_DecryptUpdate()/R_SCE_AES256GCM_DecryptInit() and started debugging process (I did not have any warnings or errors during the compilation phase) I have next problem:

The line 246 in the "bsp_security.c" file next:

SCB->NSACR = (SCB->NSACR & ~(SCB_NSACR_CP10_Msk | SCB_NSACR_CP11_Msk)) | ((SCB_NSACR_CP10_11_VAL << SCB_NSACR_CP10_Pos) & (SCB_NSACR_CP10_Msk | SCB_NSACR_CP11_Msk));

In ARM Cortex-M33 Devices Generic User Guide, 4.2.16 Non-secure Access Control Register I found a table 4-28 NSACR bit assignments.

I did not find any information about how I should setting FPU module (in project settings or FSP) if I want to use SCE module (AES-256).

I use: FPU 4.2.0, GCC ARM Embedded 10.3.1.20210824.

How can I fix this problem?

Content.HtmlDescription:
Hi.

I have EK-RA4M2 and I test the TrustZone feature.

I created two project:

- secure project: SCE Protected Mode, ARM TrustZone Context RA Port and another stacks;

- non secure project: GPIO and SCI(UART) stacks.

I did not inject any keys to the MCU.

I tested:

- R_SCE_RandomNumberGenerate() - works;

- R_SCE_SHA256_Init()/R_SCE_SHA256_Update()/R_SCE_SHA256_FInal() - work, the calculation result is correct.

But, when I added the functions to my code: R_SCE_AES256GCM_DecryptInit()/R_SCE_AES256GCM_DecryptUpdate()/R_SCE_AES256GCM_DecryptInit() and started debugging process (I did not have any warnings or errors during the compilation phase) I have next problem:

The line 246 in the "bsp_security.c" file next:

SCB->NSACR = (SCB->NSACR & ~(SCB_NSACR_CP10_Msk | SCB_NSACR_CP11_Msk)) | ((SCB_NSACR_CP10_11_VAL << SCB_NSACR_CP10_Pos) & (SCB_NSACR_CP10_Msk | SCB_NSACR_CP11_Msk));

In ARM Cortex-M33 Devices Generic User Guide, 4.2.16 Non-secure Access Control Register I found a table 4-28 NSACR bit assignments.

I did not find any information about how I should setting FPU module (in project settings or FSP) if I want to use SCE module (AES-256).

I use: FPU 4.2.0, GCC ARM Embedded 10.3.1.20210824.

How can I fix this problem?

Threads.Subject: Opening a  FileX file for reading during NexT Duo tftp_server writing the same file.
Threads.Body:
Hi there,

I am using the TFTP server to load a file to my board (EK-RA6M3) via  PC. I have another task waiting till this file is loaded, in order to read it,

I try to detect it using the FileX API :

fx_directory_next_entry_find().

The presence of the file is detected indeed, but, despite my beliefs, even if  still being updated by TFTP : the program hangs.

I thought the entries in the target directory were not upgraded till the file wriing activity ( by TFTP ) was in progress. Evidently I am wrong.

Any thought ? Any way to understand the file is still opened by TFTP and considering it not yet ready in the file system ?

Thanks in advance

Fabio

Threads.Subject: RA4E1 Sub clock Freezing on startup
Threads.Body:
Hi 

 For my project I am using R7FA4E10B2CFM controllers where the RTC is used with battery backup. the sub clock oscillator used is 32.768KHz from Wurth elektronik (IQD) part number 830009678. with 12pf ceramic caps 

Now for the issue I made 10 or so boards and found out that two out of ten boards work perfectly without any issues rest of the boards get stuck at FSP_HARDWARE_REGISTER_WAIT(R_RTC->RCR2_b.RESET, 0U);

Four boards from the remaining boards which are stuck in the loop come out of the loop by touching the crystal by bare hands or fingers somehow but the RTC does not work the clock does not start. and the remaining boards remain stuck at the  FSP_HARDWARE_REGISTER_WAIT(R_RTC->RCR2_b.RESET, 0U); loop

Trying to figure out for days now what might be wrong and the pattern of working is very inconsistent, The same crystal I have used with different clock IC such as the DS1307 the crystal and the IC works Perfectly I use the same crystal with my SYNERGY S7 boards there also I have never faced such a problem everything works as it should only for this MCU I am facing a lot of problems.

Work arounds I have done 

1) changing the load caps to different values but the result is same tried 12Pf, 15Pf, 22Pf, 27Pf, 30Pf, 33Pf. but the result is same the only difference was with the boards that were stuck in the loop came out of the loop only after touching the crystal by hand when capacitance was 27Pf and 30Pf.

2) As per the Fast Prototyping board design of RA4E1 they have used 27Pf of load caps with ABS06-32.768KHz crystal so I used the same loading caps but still it gets stuck.

3) As per the AN design guide for sub-clock circuits they have used the limiting resistor and feedback but to implement that I need to make the boards again! also I have never come across in any design like this being implemented on any of the boards or kits so I followed the basic design with keeping the crystal and caps as close to the MCU as possible.

4) the software implementation to check for POR and clear the resistor but still the same issue

if ((R_SYSTEM->RSTSR0 & R_SYSTEM_RSTSR0_PORF_Msk) != 0U)
{
/* Clear the START bit and wait for the value to synchronize. */
R_RTC->RCR2_b.START = 0U;
FSP_HARDWARE_REGISTER_WAIT(R_RTC->RCR2_b.START, 0U);
}

5) Used different FSP but still the same issue.

Kindly advice what could have gone wrong as I already said before the results are very inconsistent some work some do not I have ran out of ideas of what is causing the RTC to fail. 

Regards

Pranav

Threads.Subject: GPT output with one-shot pulse mode. The outputs polarity have been changed after update Dutycycle.
Threads.Body:
Hello,

   I'm using the GPT timer in one-shot pulse mode and I copied the code from here GPT One-Shot Pulse Mode Example

The trailing edge will be set once in my application but the leading edges of GTIOA and GTIOB will be changed from user command.

The outputs after resetting are correct. 

However, if I update the leading edge several times(5-20 times), the ports' polarity has been changed (inverted).  I couldn't turn it back and it need to be reset.

Any suggestion to check why my output ports have been inverted after updating the leading edge?

Thank you in advance.

here are some details that may be useful. 

RA6M1

FSP 5.1.0

PLCKD 120MHz

one-shot pulse initial

#define GPT_ONE_SHOT_EXAMPLE_DUTY_CYCLE_GTCCRD_GTCCRF    (0x116520U) // 9.5ms
#define GPT_ONE_SHOT_EXAMPLE_DUTY_CYCLE_GTCCRC           (0x116510U)
#define GPT_ONE_SHOT_EXAMPLE_DUTY_CYCLE_GTCCRE           (0x116510U)

There are only 3 values that will be used to update the leading edges

LEVEL_1 (0xCD140U)
LEVEL_2 (0x927C0U)
LEVEL_3 (0x1U)

I update the duty cycle by using this code

// For first channel
R_GPT_DutyCycleSet (&g_timer_triac_ctrl, timervalue, GPT_IO_PIN_GTIOCA | GPT_IO_PIN_ONE_SHOT_LEADING_EDGE);
// For second channel
R_GPT_DutyCycleSet (&g_timer_triac_ctrl, timervalue, GPT_IO_PIN_GTIOCB | GPT_IO_PIN_ONE_SHOT_LEADING_EDGE);

Threads.Subject: E2 studio showing the wrong values.
Threads.Body:
I have an RA4M1, and I am capturing the mains zero crossing signal, subtracting the previous value from the captured value to determine the cycle length. On a 32MHz clock, on UK 50Hz mains, it should read 320000.

However, if I insert a breakpoint after it has done the calculation (2 instructions after the read of the capture register) e2 studio gives the wrong answer, usually about 2560000, eight times too high.

if I save the previous calculated value, I.e.from the two previous captures, it is correct.

Any thoughts?

code writes to r3 and r4 "APSR value which is 0x60000000" and writes to r1 "test value which is 0x50000000" and tries to compare r1(0x50000000) and r3(0x60000000) and fails.

I think APSR value has smt wrong because it doesn't change, it is always 0x60000000. 

I don't know how to fix that. 

I hope you help me figure out.

Regards.

Threads.Subject: CAN Reception Problem
Threads.Body:
I want to receive the CAN frames transmitted by the STM32. I've written the following program. After reception, I want to print them in the ClearTerminal through UART communication.
And I am not sure what should be the exact input of the printf function.

#include "common_utils.h"

static can_frame_t rx_frame = {RESET_VALUE}; //frame for storing the received message

/*Flags set from the callback function*/
static volatile bool rx_flag = false;
static volatile bool err_flag = false;
static volatile bool transferComplete = false;

FSP_CPP_HEADER
void R_BSP_WarmStart(bsp_warm_start_event_t event);
FSP_CPP_FOOTER

void g_uart_cb(uart_callback_args_t *p_args){

if(p_args ->event == UART_EVENT_TX_COMPLETE){
transferComplete = true;
}
}

int puts(const char *str){

transferComplete = false;
fsp_err_t err = FSP_SUCCESS;
uint8_t tx_data[256] = {0};
int len = 0;
len = sprintf((char*)tx_data, str);

//WRITE DATA TO UART
err = R_SCI_UART_Write(&g_uart0_ctrl,tx_data,(uint32_t)len);
if(err != FSP_SUCCESS){
__BKPT(0);
}
return 0;
}

void can_callback(can_callback_args_t *p_args)
{
switch (p_args->event)
{
case CAN_EVENT_TX_COMPLETE:
{
break;
}
case CAN_EVENT_RX_COMPLETE:
{
rx_flag = true;
memcpy(&rx_frame, &p_args->frame, sizeof(can_frame_t)); //copy the received data to rx_frame
break;
}
case CAN_EVENT_MAILBOX_MESSAGE_LOST: //overwrite/overrun error event
case CAN_EVENT_BUS_RECOVERY: //Bus recovery error event
case CAN_EVENT_ERR_BUS_OFF: //error Bus Off event
case CAN_EVENT_ERR_PASSIVE: //error passive event
case CAN_EVENT_ERR_WARNING: //error warning event
case CAN_EVENT_ERR_BUS_LOCK: //error bus lock
case CAN_EVENT_ERR_CHANNEL: //error channel
case CAN_EVENT_ERR_GLOBAL: //error global
case CAN_EVENT_TX_ABORTED: //error transmit abort
case CAN_EVENT_TX_FIFO_EMPTY: //error transmit FIFO is empty
case CAN_EVENT_FIFO_MESSAGE_LOST: //error FIFO message lost
{
err_flag = true; //set flag bit
break;
}

}//switch
}//callback

/*void check(fsp_err_t error){
if(error != FSP_SUCCESS){
__BKPT(0);
}
}*/

/*******************************************************************************************************************//**
* main() is generated by the RA Configuration editor and is used to generate threads if an RTOS is used. This function
* is called by main() when no RTOS is used.
**********************************************************************************************************************/
void hal_entry(void)
{
fsp_err_t err;
err = R_SCI_UART_Open(&g_uart0_ctrl, &g_uart0_cfg);
if(err != FSP_SUCCESS)
{
__BKPT(0);
}

//Configuring CGC
err = R_CGC_Open(&g_cgc0_ctrl, &g_cgc0_cfg);
if(err != FSP_SUCCESS){
__BKPT(0);
}

err = R_CGC_ClockStart(&g_cgc0_ctrl, CGC_CLOCK_MAIN_OSC, NULL);
if(err != FSP_SUCCESS){
__BKPT(0);
}

do{
err = R_CGC_ClockCheck(&g_cgc0_ctrl, CGC_CLOCK_MAIN_OSC );
}while(FSP_ERR_NOT_STABILIZED == err);
if(err != FSP_SUCCESS){
__BKPT(0);
}

//Configuring CAN
err = R_CAN_Open(&g_can0_ctrl, &g_can0_cfg);
if(err != FSP_SUCCESS){
__BKPT(0);
}

if(rx_flag == true){
/*reset the flag*/
rx_flag=false;
while(1){
printf(rx_frame.data);  //not sure about this line
R_BSP_SoftwareDelay(500,1000);
}
}
/* TODO: add your own code here */

#if BSP_TZ_SECURE_BUILD
/* Enter non-secure code */
R_BSP_NonSecureEnter();
#endif
}

/*******************************************************************************************************************//**
* This function is called at various points during the startup process. This implementation uses the event that is
* called right before main() to set up the pins.
*
* @param[in] event Where at in the start up process the code is currently at
**********************************************************************************************************************/
void R_BSP_WarmStart(bsp_warm_start_event_t event)
{
if (BSP_WARM_START_RESET == event)
{
#if BSP_FEATURE_FLASH_LP_VERSION != 0

/* Enable reading from data flash. */
R_FACI_LP->DFLCTL = 1U;

/* Would normally have to wait tDSTOP(6us) for data flash recovery. Placing the enable here, before clock and
* C runtime initialization, should negate the need for a delay since the initialization will typically take more than 6us. */
#endif
}

if (BSP_WARM_START_POST_C == event)
{
/* C runtime environment and system clocks are setup. */

/* Configure pins. */
R_IOPORT_Open (&g_ioport_ctrl, g_ioport.p_cfg);
}
}

#if BSP_TZ_SECURE_BUILD

BSP_CMSE_NONSECURE_ENTRY void template_nonsecure_callable ();

/* Trustzone Secure Projects require at least one nonsecure callable function in order to build (Remove this if it is not required to build). */
BSP_CMSE_NONSECURE_ENTRY void template_nonsecure_callable ()
{

}
#endif

Threads.Subject: FreeRTOS RA6M3 TCP Socket Receiving Data Sending Data with DHCP
Threads.Body:
Dear Team,

I need to receive data from TCP socket at defined port, and also need to send data to known IP address/port through TCP socket.

With help of sample code pack I am able to get IP through DHCP, and ping to another machine on same network or on internet.

Referring sample code : EK-RA6M3: r20an0560eu0144-ek-ra6m3-exampleprojects\ek_ra6m3\ethernet\ethernet_ek_ra6m3_ep\e2studio

However I am not able to integrate FreeRTOS portal code for creating socket, send data and receive data:

TCP Networking Tutorial - Creating, Configuring and Binding TCP Client and Server Sockets (freertos.org)

TCP Networking Tutorial - Send Data Using a TCP Socket (freertos.org)

TCP Networking Tutorial - Receiving Data Using a TCP Socket (freertos.org)

Also I am not able to find sample RA code to implement these functionality.

As socket is more practical way to send data to PCs running desktop applications (not web based) I am very keen to make my code work in this way.

Hoping for you kind help to implement same. 

Thanks in advance.

Kind regards,

Nilesh A Korde

Threads.Subject: Using e2 Studio wit the Arduino R4 WiFi board
Threads.Body:
I just got my R4 WiFi and really wanted to dive into the guts of it.
I love the eclipse IDE so looks like e2 Studio was the way to go.
I found an example online about creating a "Bare Metal Blinky Project" and
seems like my code should work but of course it doesn't.

I figured out how to upload my code using the arduino-cli.exe tool
(unfortunately you must install the complete Arduino IDE and R4 board package to do this)

This simple Blinky code works when compiled and loaded through the Arduino IDE

while(1)

{

R_BSP_PinWrite (LED_PIN, BSP_IO_LEVEL_HIGH);

R_BSP_SoftwareDelay (500, BSP_DELAY_UNITS_MILLISECONDS);

R_BSP_PinWrite (LED_PIN, BSP_IO_LEVEL_LOW);

R_BSP_SoftwareDelay (500, BSP_DELAY_UNITS_MILLISECONDS);

}

However no luck with e2 Studio .. Here's some details

Board= Custom User Board, Device = R7FA4M1AB3CFM

I have defined as BSP_IO_PORT_01_PIN_02 which is built in LED on the Arduino R4 board.

My clock configuration is set to HOCO 48MHz

It would be great if there was a way to select the Arduino R4 board in e2 Studio.

Has anybody else tried this?

Thanks

Threads.Subject: Renesas IDE and BSP Experience
Threads.Body:
I have been doing this for over a decade and have worked with nearly a dozen vendors. I have found Renesas e2 studio and board bring-up extremely confusing. 

Now, I understand that people who are used to working with this ecosystem quite like it, but its not as intuitive for someone coming in from a different vendor. 

The BSP is very tightly coupled with the drivers and they are forcing us to use their IDE for all purposes. Now this might be fine if you're developing a product in the mid-00's. But in this era of headless builds, HIL testing & running remote elastic agents, this comes across as a needlessly protective.

As for examples, they are very few and far in between & seem to work only for very simple & extremely fixed cases. This isn't helpful when you're ultimate plan is to integrate multiple libraries from multiple repositories & be able to build it remotely for whatever HIL testing that might follow.

I'm trying to get a simple LED and UART working for a distributed build system, Its taken me half a day to bring up 4 microcontrollers & 1 whole day and no tangible progress on the RA4W1 dev board. 

Any pointers on adding a simple uart to the example blinky project (NO RTOS) on the e2 studio would be very very helpful.

Threads.Subject: Audio Clipping Issues with RA6M2 using WM8904 in Master Mode and I2S in Slave Mode
Threads.Body:
Hello Renesas Community,

I am working on a project using the RA6M2 1MB microcontroller and encountering an issue with audio playback. My setup involves the WM8904 audio codec operating in Master Mode, while the RA6M2's I2S (with DTC enabled) is configured in Slave Mode. I am generating an external clock for the codec at 32.768kHz using the R_GPT timer channel 1. The project is built on FreeRTOS, featuring multiple concurrent threads.

Audio Configuration:

  • Mode: Mono
  • Bit Depth: 16-bit
  • Sample Rate: 16kHz

In my main thread, I generate a request to play audio by sending data through a queue, which is then read in a separate audio thread. This request contains multiple IDs for audio samples, and in the audio thread, I read these samples from a Winbond 1Gbit flash memory at 30MHz SPI speed.

The issue I'm facing is audio clipping: I experience some type of noise when a new frame is loaded from the flash memory and played. I am utilizing a ping-pong mechanism for writing data, adapted from the FSP SSI example. The I2S frames are written both from the main loop and through an interrupt. If I increase the buffer size to 64000 bytes I minimize(very low) the noise but I get a delay in audio because I need to write these empty buffers before writing actual audio stream data - 

shBuffer.size0 = sizeof(shBuffer.dualBuffer[0]);

memset (shBuffer.dualBuffer[0], 0x0, shBuffer.size0);

audio->flags.ping = 1;

shBuffer.size1 = sizeof(shBuffer.dualBuffer[1]);

memset (shBuffer.dualBuffer[1], 0x0, shBuffer.size1);

audio->flags.pong = 1; , if I do not write these empty buffers then some of the start frames do not play(or are lost).

I have attached some relevant code snippets and output below. I would greatly appreciate any insights or suggestions to resolve this audio clipping issue.

void AudioPlayerInit(Audio_Typedef *audio)
{

    fsp_err_t status = FSP_SUCCESS;

    if (CODEC_Initialize())
    {
        __BKPT(0);
    }

    //setup code
    AudioCodecSetup ();

    status = ssi_timer.p_api->open (ssi_timer.p_ctrl, ssi_timer.p_cfg);
    assert(status == FSP_SUCCESS);

    status = ssi_timer.p_api->start (ssi_timer.p_ctrl);
    assert(status == FSP_SUCCESS);

    status = g_i2s0.p_api->open (g_i2s0.p_ctrl, g_i2s0.p_cfg);
    assert(status == FSP_SUCCESS);

    audio->flags.data_ready = false;
    audio->flags.from_loop = true;

    g_i2s0.p_api->mute (g_i2s0.p_ctrl, I2S_MUTE_ON);
    g_i2s0.p_api->stop (g_i2s0.p_ctrl);

    classd_init ();

    classd_power_on (CLASS_D_POWEROFF);
    classd_shutdown (CLASS_D_SHUTDN_EN);
    classd_set_gain (3);

}

#include "thread_audio.h"
#include "drivers/gen/events_ctrl.h"
#include "drivers/audio/audio.h"

/* thread_audio entry function */
/* pvParameters contains TaskHandle_t */
void thread_audio_entry(void *pvParameters)
{
    FSP_PARAMETER_NOT_USED (pvParameters);

    xEventGroupWaitBits(SYSEventsGroup, SYSEVENT_FSD_READY, pdFALSE, pdFALSE, portMAX_DELAY);

    if(xSemaphoreTake(xAudioPlayerMutex,portMAX_DELAY)) {
        AudioPlayerInit(&AudioObj);
        xSemaphoreGive(xAudioPlayerMutex);
    }

    while (1)
    {
        if(xSemaphoreTake(xAudioPlayerMutex,portMAX_DELAY)) {
            AudioPlayerTask(&AudioObj);
            xSemaphoreGive(xAudioPlayerMutex);
        }
        vTaskDelay(1);
    }
}
#define MAX_SHARED_BUFFER_SIZE 8000
#define MAX_VOICE_PACKET_SIZE  (MAX_SHARED_BUFFER_SIZE/2)
#define MAX_PING_PONG_BUFFER_SIZE (MAX_VOICE_PACKET_SIZE/2)

typedef struct {

    union {

        uint8_t flashBytes[MAX_SHARED_BUFFER_SIZE];
        uint8_t usbBytes[MAX_SHARED_BUFFER_SIZE];
        uint8_t dualBuffer[2][MAX_SHARED_BUFFER_SIZE/2];
        uint16_t integ[MAX_SHARED_BUFFER_SIZE/2];
        uint16_t audioBytes[MAX_VOICE_PACKET_SIZE];
        int16_t audioPingPong[2][MAX_PING_PONG_BUFFER_SIZE];

        struct {
          uint16_t id;
          uint16_t reserved1;
          uint32_t reserved2;
          uint32_t size;
          uint32_t location;
        }sampleInfo[15];

    };
    union {
        struct {
        uint32_t size0;
        uint32_t size1;
        };
        uint32_t size;
    };
}SHAREDBuffer_Typedef;

void AudioPlayerTask(Audio_Typedef *audio)
{

    switch (audio->state)
    {

        case AUDIO_IDLE:

            if (isAudioPlayerRequestPending ())
            {
                audio->state = AUDIO_GETSAMPLE;
                xEventGroupSetBits (SYSEventsGroup, SYSEVENT_AUDIO_PLAYING);
            }
        break;

        case AUDIO_GETSAMPLE:
            if (AudioPlayerGetLastPendingRequest (&audio->request))
            {
                classd_power_on (CLASS_D_POWERON);
                classd_shutdown (CLASS_D_SHUTDN_DS);

                g_i2s0.p_api->mute (g_i2s0.p_ctrl, I2S_MUTE_OFF);

                audio->state = AUDIO_PLAYING;
            }
            else
            {
                audio->state = AUDIO_DONE;
            }
        break;
        case AUDIO_PLAYING:

            if (!AudioPlaying (audio))
            {
                audio->state = AUDIO_DONE;
            }

        break;

        case AUDIO_DONE:

            if (audio->request.totalSamples > audio->playingId)
            {
                audio->state = AUDIO_PLAYING;
            }
            else
            {
                xEventGroupClearBits (SYSEventsGroup, SYSEVENT_AUDIO_PLAYING);
                g_i2s0.p_api->mute (g_i2s0.p_ctrl, I2S_MUTE_ON);
                classd_power_on (CLASS_D_POWEROFF);
                classd_shutdown (CLASS_D_SHUTDN_EN);
                audio->playingId = 0;
                audio->state = AUDIO_IDLE;
            }

        break;
    }
}
BaseType_t AudioPlaying(Audio_Typedef *audio)
{

    static uint8_t state = 0;

    switch (state)
    {

        case 0:

            shBuffer.size0 = sizeof(shBuffer.dualBuffer[0]);
            memset (shBuffer.dualBuffer[0], 0x0, shBuffer.size0);
            audio->flags.ping = 1;

            shBuffer.size1 = sizeof(shBuffer.dualBuffer[1]);
            memset (shBuffer.dualBuffer[1], 0x0, shBuffer.size1);
            audio->flags.pong = 1;

            if (AudioValidateSampleId (audio))
            {

                AudioSample_GetAddressLength (audio->request.sampleids[audio->playingId], &audio->sampleTSize,
                                              &audio->sampleTLocation);

                audio->playingSampleSize = audio->sampleTSize;
                audio->playingSampleLocation = AUDIOSAMPLE_CONTENT_START_PG + (audio->sampleTLocation / 256);

                audio->playingId++;

                state = 1;
            }
            else
            {
                audio->request.totalSamples = 0;
                state = 2;
            }
        break;

        case 1:

            if (AudioPlayFromFLash (audio) != pdTRUE)
            {
                state = 2;
            }

        break;

        case 2:

            audio->sampleTSize = 0;
            audio->sampleTLocation = 0;

            state = 0;

            return pdFALSE;
        break;
    }

    return pdTRUE;
}
BaseType_t AudioPlayFromFLash(Audio_Typedef *audio)
{

    BaseType_t status = AudioStreamBufferUpdate (audio);

    if (audio->flags.from_loop)
    {
        if (audio->flags.ping == 1 && audio->flags.activeBuffer == 0)
        {
            if (audio->flags.data_ready == false)
            {
                audio->flags.data_ready = true;
                AudioI2SWrite (shBuffer.dualBuffer[0], shBuffer.size0);
                memset (shBuffer.dualBuffer[0], 0, sizeof(shBuffer.dualBuffer[0]));
                shBuffer.size0 = 0;
                audio->flags.ping = 0;
                shBuffer.size0 = 0;
                audio->flags.activeBuffer = 1;
                audio->flags.from_loop = false;
            }

        }
        else if (audio->flags.pong == 1 && audio->flags.activeBuffer == 1)
        {
            if (audio->flags.data_ready == false)
            {

                audio->flags.data_ready = true;
                AudioI2SWrite (shBuffer.dualBuffer[1], shBuffer.size1);
                memset (shBuffer.dualBuffer[1], 0, sizeof(shBuffer.dualBuffer[1]));
                shBuffer.size1 = 0;
                audio->flags.pong = 0;
                audio->flags.activeBuffer = 0;
                audio->flags.from_loop = false;
            }
        }
    }

    return status;
}

BaseType_t AudioStreamBufferUpdate(Audio_Typedef *audio)
{

    if (audio->playingSampleSize == 0 && !audio->flags.ping && !audio->flags.pong && !audio->flags.data_ready)
    {
        return pdFALSE;
    }

    if (audio->flags.ping == 0 && audio->playingSampleSize)
    {

        if (audio->playingSampleSize > sizeof(shBuffer.dualBuffer[0]))
        {
            shBuffer.size0 = sizeof(shBuffer.dualBuffer[0]);
        }
        else
        {
            shBuffer.size0 = audio->playingSampleSize;
        }

        if (W25qxx_ReadFlash (&winbond1gb, shBuffer.dualBuffer[0], audio->playingSampleLocation,
                              audio->playSampleOffset, shBuffer.size0))
        {
            audio->playSampleOffset = 0;
            audio->flags.ping = 1;
            audio->playingSampleSize -= shBuffer.size0;
            audio->playingSampleLocation += (shBuffer.size0 / 256);
        }
    }

    if (audio->flags.pong == 0 && audio->playingSampleSize)
    {

        if (audio->playingSampleSize > sizeof(shBuffer.dualBuffer[1]))
        {
            shBuffer.size1 = sizeof(shBuffer.dualBuffer[1]);
        }
        else
        {
            shBuffer.size1 = audio->playingSampleSize;
        }

        if (W25qxx_ReadFlash (&winbond1gb, shBuffer.dualBuffer[1], audio->playingSampleLocation,
                              audio->playSampleOffset, shBuffer.size1))
        {
            audio->playSampleOffset = 0;
            audio->flags.pong = 1;
            audio->playingSampleSize -= shBuffer.size1;
            audio->playingSampleLocation += (shBuffer.size1 / 256);
        }
    }

    return pdTRUE;
}
void g_i2s0_callback(i2s_callback_args_t *p_args)
{
    i2s_events = p_args->event;

    if ((I2S_EVENT_TX_EMPTY == p_args->event) || (I2S_EVENT_IDLE == p_args->event))
    {
        //data_sample_pending = false;

        AudioObj.flags.data_ready = false;

        if (AudioObj.flags.ping == 1 && AudioObj.flags.activeBuffer == 0)
        {

            if (AudioObj.flags.data_ready == false)
            {
                AudioObj.flags.data_ready = true;
                AudioI2SWrite (shBuffer.dualBuffer[0], shBuffer.size0);
                memset (shBuffer.dualBuffer[0], 0, sizeof(shBuffer.dualBuffer[0]));
                shBuffer.size0 = 0;
                AudioObj.flags.ping = 0;
                AudioObj.flags.activeBuffer = 1;
                AudioObj.flags.from_loop = false;
            }

        }
        else if (AudioObj.flags.pong == 1 && AudioObj.flags.activeBuffer == 1)
        {

            if (AudioObj.flags.data_ready == false)
            {
                AudioObj.flags.data_ready = true;
                AudioI2SWrite (shBuffer.dualBuffer[1], shBuffer.size1);
                memset (shBuffer.dualBuffer[1], 0, sizeof(shBuffer.dualBuffer[1]));
                shBuffer.size1 = 0;
                AudioObj.flags.pong = 0;
                AudioObj.flags.activeBuffer = 0;
                AudioObj.flags.from_loop = false;
            }
        }
        else
        {
            AudioObj.flags.from_loop = true;
        }

    }
}
//g_transfer4
void AudioI2SWrite(uint8_t *buffer, uint32_t size)
{
    fsp_err_t status = FSP_SUCCESS;

    //data_sample_pending = true;

    status = R_SSI_Write (&g_i2s0_ctrl, buffer, size);

    if (FSP_SUCCESS == status)
    {
        // AudioObj.flags.data_ready = false;
    }
    else
    {
        // __asm("nop");
    }
}

Threads.Subject: How to store image in QSPI Flash?
Threads.Body:
Dear all,

     I use the RA6M3 in my project.

     The project has lots of images for emWin.

     I want to store image in external flash.

     I follow the step from synergy method. But it cannot work.

       The method for synergy is as below link.

Threads.Subject: Access SD Card on RA6M5 Controller
Threads.Body:
Hi team,

I wanted to access the SD Card contents... both read and write operations on SD card in R7FA6M5BF3CFC microcontroller... Request you to please provide step by step instructions on how to handle this issue... Am using E2Studio ide

Am using SanDisk 64 GB SD card for this requirement...The Clock set for PCLKB is 50Mhz...And i have selected the stack SDHI(r_sdhi).. And g_transfer0 Transfer(r_dtc) i.e DTC instead of DMAC....

Here am not using any thread and am not wanting to use it... Below is my code 

void hal_entry(void)
{
/* TODO: add your own code here */
fsp_err_t err = FSP_SUCCESS;

g_transfer_complete_spi = true;

if (g_transfer_complete_spi == true)
{
//SD Card Implementation
for (uint32_t i = 0; i < SDHI_MAX_BLOCK_SIZE; i++)
{
g_src[i] = (uint8_t) ('A' + (i % 26));
}


R_BSP_SoftwareDelay (100U, BSP_DELAY_UNITS_MILLISECONDS);
/* Open the SDHI driver. */
err = R_SDHI_Open (&g_sdmmc0_ctrl, &g_sdmmc0_cfg);
assert(FSP_SUCCESS == err);

R_BSP_SoftwareDelay (100U, BSP_DELAY_UNITS_MILLISECONDS);
/* Check if card is inserted. */
err = R_SDHI_StatusGet (&g_sdmmc0_ctrl, &status);
assert(FSP_SUCCESS == err);
if (!status.card_inserted)
{
while (!g_card_inserted)
{
__NOP();
/* Wait for a card insertion interrupt. */
}
}

/* A device shall be ready to accept the first command within 1ms from detecting VDD min. Reference section 6.4.1.1
* "Power Up Time of Card" in the SD Physical Layer Simplified Specification Version 6.00. */
R_BSP_SoftwareDelay (1U, BSP_DELAY_UNITS_MILLISECONDS);
/* Initialize the SD card. This should not be done until the card is plugged in for SD devices. */
err = R_SDHI_MediaInit (&g_sdmmc0_ctrl, NULL);
assert(FSP_SUCCESS == err);
err = R_SDHI_Write (&g_sdmmc0_ctrl, g_src, 3, 1);
assert(FSP_SUCCESS == err);
while (!g_transfer_complete)
{
/* Wait for transfer. */
}
err = R_SDHI_Read (&g_sdmmc0_ctrl, g_dest, 3, 1);
assert(FSP_SUCCESS == err);
while (!g_transfer_complete)
{
/* Wait for transfer. */
}
}

#if BSP_TZ_SECURE_BUILD
/* Enter non-secure code */
R_BSP_NonSecureEnter();
#endif
}

void callback_sdcard(sdmmc_callback_args_t *p_args)
{

switch (p_args->event)
{
case SDMMC_EVENT_CARD_REMOVED:
__BKPT(0);
break;
case SDMMC_EVENT_CARD_INSERTED:
__BKPT(0);
break;
case SDMMC_EVENT_RESPONSE:
break;
case SDMMC_EVENT_SDIO:
break;
case SDMMC_EVENT_TRANSFER_COMPLETE:
g_transfer_complete = 1;
break;
case SDMMC_EVENT_TRANSFER_ERROR:
break;
case SDMMC_EVENT_ERASE_COMPLETE:
break;
case SDMMC_EVENT_ERASE_BUSY:
break;
default:
break;
}
}

Here the SD card is not getting detected... The SD card is in good condition... Here the Callback function is not getting triggerred... when i debugged using JLINK with the SD card inserted on Microcontroller , R_SDHI_Open (&g_sdmmc0_ctrl, &g_sdmmc0_cfg); is successful, and   err = R_SDHI_StatusGet (&g_sdmmc0_ctrl, &status); is also successful.. But inside the "status" parameter, There is "card_inserted" parameter which is always false... 

Request you to kindly do the needful.. Do let me know  for any queries...

 

Regards,

Vikram.

Threads.Subject: Issues while working on SPI in RA6M5 Controller
Threads.Body:
Hi team,

I am wanting to create an SPI interface between RA6M5 (R7FA6M5BF3CFC) microcontroller and NOR FLASH device...Here i could not able to read the data from the NOR Flash... Here i have attached my project , RA6M5 schematics and NOR Flash datasheet here... 

Here am using SPI interface, and the related pins are 

1)P202 : MISO
2)P203 : MOSI
3)P204 : SPCK
4)P207 : CS

Here am connecting

VCC of the microcontroller to VCC of NOR flash device,

GND of the microcontroller to GND of NOR flash device, 

P202 is connected to SO/SIO1 of the NOR Flash device,

P203 is connected to SI/SIO0 of the NOR Flash device,

P204 is connected to SCLK of the NOR Flash device,

P207 is connected to CS# of the NOR Flash device,

Here i have set baud rate as 133000... Kindly let me know what further actions are to be taken to make SPI interface working... 

Thanks & regards,

Vikram

Threads.Body:

And only the first character of the entire string is getting sent during UART Communication.

This is the code: 

#include "hal_data.h"
#include "string.h"
#include "stdio.h"
uint8_t DBG_BUFFER[1200];

__IO uint32_t uwTick;

void SysTick_Handler(void);
void delay(uint32_t);
uint32_t get_ticks(void);

#define APP_DEBUG_TRACE(FORMAT,...){\
memset(DBG_BUFFER, 0x00, sizeof DBG_BUFFER);\
sprintf((char *)DBG_BUFFER,FORMAT,##__VA_ARGS__); \
R_SCI_UART_Write(&g_uart0_ctrl,DBG_BUFFER,strlen((char *)DBG_BUFFER));\
}

void SysTick_Handler(void)
{
uwTick++;
}

void delay(uint32_t tick)
{
uint32_t systickcnt;
systickcnt = uwTick;
while ((uwTick - systickcnt) < tick);
}

uint32_t get_ticks(void)
{
return uwTick;
}

FSP_CPP_HEADER
void R_BSP_WarmStart(bsp_warm_start_event_t event);
FSP_CPP_FOOTER

volatile bool flag = false;

/* Callback function */
void user_uart_callback(uart_callback_args_t *p_args)
{
/* TODO: add your own code here */
if (UART_EVENT_TX_COMPLETE == p_args->event)
{
flag = true;
}
}

* main() is generated by the RA Configuration editor and is used to generate threads if an RTOS is used. This function
* is called by main() when no RTOS is used.
**********************************************************************************************************************/

{
__enable_irq();
SysTick_Config(SystemCoreClock / 1000);
const uint8_t buf[] = "Test\t\n";

R_SCI_UART_Open(&g_uart9_ctrl, &g_uart9_cfg);   //opening UART

while(1){
R_SCI_UART_Write(&g_uart9_ctrl, (uint8_t *)buf, sizeof(buf));
delay(1000);

if(flag == true){
break;
}

}


#if BSP_TZ_SECURE_BUILD

R_BSP_NonSecureEnter();
#endif
}

/*******************************************************************************************************************//**
* This function is called at various points during the startup process. This implementation uses the event that is
* called right before main() to set up the pins.
*
* @param[in] event Where at in the start up process the code is currently at
**********************************************************************************************************************/
void R_BSP_WarmStart(bsp_warm_start_event_t event)
{
if (BSP_WARM_START_RESET == event)
{
#if BSP_FEATURE_FLASH_LP_VERSION != 0

/* Enable reading from data flash. */
R_FACI_LP->DFLCTL = 1U;

/* Would normally have to wait tDSTOP(6us) for data flash recovery. Placing the enable here, before clock and
* C runtime initialization, should negate the need for a delay since the initialization will typically take more than 6us. */

}

if (BSP_WARM_START_POST_C == event)
{
/* C runtime environment and system clocks are setup. */

/* Configure pins. */
R_IOPORT_Open (&g_ioport_ctrl, g_ioport.p_cfg);
}
}

Threads.Body:
Hi team,

Am using RA6M5 microcontroller, we have 3 I2C interfaces in this microcontroller, Here i have simulated I2C scenario... Here are the following steps : 

1) Created a stack of type r_iic_master and used the pins P409(SDA) and P410(SCL)
2) Created another stack of type r_iic_slave and used the pins P511(SDA) and P512(SCL)
Note: I just want to use the I2C communication protocol in the same Microcontroller..(I dont want any external device to connect) 
Here i have used the jumper wires to connect SDA and SCL lines from Master to Slave.... In the configuration part, i am supposed to provide Slave address, Can you kindly help me on what slave address is to be provided under Master and Slave stack ?
I am attaching the project in to this mail... Kindly look into it and let me know for any queries

Thanks & regards,

Vikram

Threads.Subject: RTOS Resources on FreeRTOS stack not decreasing
Threads.Body:
Hello,

I have E2Studio 2023-10 and FSP 5.0.0 working with a RA6M4 MCU.

In my program, I had a problem about stack size and i was starting using RTOS Resource Viewer.

The problem was solved, but I can't not understand the behaviour of the stack, or maybe the meaning of the RTOS Recources fields.

Before the first call to a Function "x" I made, the stack is low (8%):

When the program enters in the "x" function, stack growns beacuse inside I have a local array:

uint8_t dataTemp[4096];

But, when the program exits this function, and this array is no longer accesible, StackUsage size and ratio doesn't decrease. It still at maximum value:

Shouldn't the stack has reduced the size?

Maybe I need any instruction to refresh the stack size?

Or maybe this is not showing the Stack usage actual and is showing  Stack usage maximum?

Thanks.

EDIT: I made some test, and I never see this value getting lower on the same debug session. Just equal or increased.

Threads.Subject: Use PWM outputs to set arbitrary colors on R7FA6M5BF3CFP
Threads.Body:
Hi,

I would like to use 3 LED GPIOs(RGB) to mix colors by GPT(GPIOs selected are PWM capable, P113, P400 and P415),

The issue I encountered is the inability to adjust the brightness of RGB and mix colors through the duty cycle API,

even though this API appears to be executing correctly, the visual difference seems to be only between 0 and 1 (on/off).

My settings, function and log are as follows, please help me to check it

void set_timer_duty_cycle_red(uint8_t duty)
{
    fsp_err_t err                           = FSP_SUCCESS;

    timer_info_t info;
    uint32_t current_period_counts;
    uint32_t duty_cycle_counts;
    char pwm_dbg[SC_LOG_MAX_LEN] = {0};

    if (duty > 100)
        duty = 100;

    err = R_GPT_InfoGet(&g_timer_red_ctrl, &info);
    if (FSP_SUCCESS != err)
    {
        /* GPT Timer InfoGet Failure message */
        //APP_ERR_PRINT ("\r\n ** R_GPT_InfoGet API failed ** \r\n");
        DBG_MSG ("\r\n ** R_GPT_InfoGet API failed ** \r\n");
    }
    else
    {
        current_period_counts = info.period_counts;

        duty_cycle_counts = (uint32_t)(((uint64_t) current_period_counts * duty) / 100);
        memset(pwm_dbg,0,SC_LOG_MAX_LEN);
        DBG_MSG ("duty :%d\r\n",duty);
        DBG_MSG ("duty_cycle_counts :%ld\r\n",duty_cycle_counts);
        err = R_GPT_DutyCycleSet(&g_timer_red_ctrl, duty_cycle_counts, (uint16_t)LED_RED);
        if(FSP_SUCCESS != err)
        {
            /* GPT Timer DutyCycleSet Failure message */
            /* In case of GPT_open is successful and DutyCycleSet fails, requires a immediate cleanup.
             * Since, cleanup for GPT open is done in timer_duty_cycle_set,Hence cleanup is not required */
            //APP_ERR_PRINT ("\r\n ** R_GPT_DutyCycleSet API failed ** \r\n");
            DBG_MSG ("\r\n ** R_GPT_DutyCycleSet API failed ** \r\n");
        }
    }

}

        R_GPT_Open(&g_timer_red_ctrl, &g_timer_red_cfg);
        
        R_GPT_Start(&g_timer_red_ctrl);

        for(uint8_t i=0; i<10;i++)
        {
            if(i%2 == 0)
            {
                set_timer_duty_cycle_red(10);
                R_BSP_SoftwareDelay(1, BSP_DELAY_UNITS_SECONDS);
                R_GPT_Reset(&g_timer_red_ctrl);
            }
            else
            {
                set_timer_duty_cycle_red(90);
                R_BSP_SoftwareDelay(1, BSP_DELAY_UNITS_SECONDS);
                R_GPT_Reset(&g_timer_red_ctrl);
            }
        }

dbg log:

[DEBUG] duty_cycle_counts :200

Threads.Subject: RA4M1 RTC oscillator waveform
Threads.Body:
Hi, all

I'm running the RTC of a RA4M1 micro with an external crystal. The oscillator and the RTC work, but the crystal signal on one pin is asymmentrical and partially clipped on the low side. 

The crystal is a 32768 Hz with a load capacitance of 12.5pF and 50k ohm of ESR. Here the schematics:


I already tried to use two 22pF capacitors (in serie they show 11pF, almost the required load capacity): the signal improves but not so much.  I tried also a different crystal of another maker with the same specs, which works fine on a R32C micro board (same circuit) but shows the same waveform on the RA4M1 board. I' would prefer not tp load the crystal with too much capacity or to insert a dumping resistor since I want to be sure that the oscillator starts in any condition.

To be honest, the Renesas RA4M1 evaluation board behaves almost the same asymmetrical and clipped way... Am I doing something wrong, maybe in the configuration? Any suggestion is very appreciated.

Thanks for help

Threads.Subject: FreeRTOS + MbedTLS
Threads.Body:
I am using E2Studio and the example projects. I am trying to get FreeRTOS and MbedTLS to work without success.

I am able to run the FreeRTOS example (Blinky) by itself. I am able to run the MbedTls example by itself.

When I create a FreeRTOS project and add MbedTLS to it, the function psa_import_key returns with an error code of -141. 

It appears as though inside psa_crypto.c, inside psa_allcate_buffer_to_slot, the function mbedtls_calloc fails.and psa_allcate_buffer_to_slot returns PSA_ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_MEMORY.

I know that somewhere either inside the FreeRTOS properties or inside the MbedTLS properties (or both) I have an incorrect setting or option chosen. Does anyone have any idea which setting it could be?

For RTOS properties I have tried with and without static and dynamic allocation. For MbedTLS I have tried with and without PLATFORM_MEMORY.

Thank you

Threads.Subject: SMI with ksz8864 ethernet switch
Threads.Body:
Hi all,

So im aware that SMI is the default com protocol used to communicate between RA devices and ethernet chips, i have followed all the instructions both hardware and software but i have noticed that basic eth_phy_read and eth_phy_write functions are not able to communicate with KSZ8864. 

I wrote 0xFF to a register and read it back but got all zeros.

         ether_phy_write(p_instance_ctrl, KSZ8864_CHIP_ID1_START_SWITCH, 0xFF);
         temp = ether_phy_read(p_instance_ctrl, KSZ8864_CHIP_ID1_START_SWITCH);
         printf("Inside driver init START SWITCH : %d\n",  temp);

I dont seem to understand where the issue is coming from. Pls help. Are those basic functions not SMI-based? Pls if you have done something related to this, pls help!!!. Thanks.
